author: Harry Walker

review: I intensely dislike being held hostage by commercial television service providers, whether they are via cable, or satellite services.  As a result, we decided to try internet streaming, and after researching the various streaming devices commercially available, we chose to try out an Amazon Fire TV device.  The setup was very simple and the device led me through all the steps with no problem.Because for reasons of economy, we do not subscribe to the faster available speeds from our internet service provider.  The Fire TV box is wireless, but I elected to get the maximum throughput of signal and used a network cable to hook the box directly to my router, without using the wireless capability.  In hindsight, I think it would work fine wirelessly..The results are extremely gratifying.  I did not have to upgrade either my older model Blu-ray player or my T.V. set at considerable expense and replace them with a "smart" unit (meaning wireless built in).  The video is smooth, the picture quality is great and except for the initial cost, there is no subscription fee to stream from the internet directly to the T.V.  I would recommend it.
